definition: to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
bewildering/odd/strange/uncanny/devil/monster/to wonder at/to blame/quite/rather
(negative prefix)/not/no
bewildering/odd/strange/uncanny/devil/monster/to wonder at/to blame/quite/rather

sentences.english: We have become desensitized to Satan's evil plans.
sentences.chinese: 我們已見怪不怪，以撒旦的邪惡計劃。

sentences.english: We had become accustomed to the hypocrisy.
sentences.chinese: 對於僞善行爲我們已經見怪不怪了。

definition: hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure

hard to understand/incomprehensible
features, face (esp. derogatorily)/look/appearance/countenance
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
to digress/to stray from the subject
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
to start a rumor
gossip/hearsay/rumor
to show respect from a distance (idiom)/to remain at a respectful distance
to remain unmoved
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
to fail to grasp the main points
to make a fuss about nothing (idiom)
